title: Where Stories Take Wing: The Making of Talers
summary: Talers is a SaaS writing platform designed to simplify and centralise the creative process for authors. Writers often lose time juggling multiple tools for drafting, notes, and organisation. Over 38 weeks, I led the product design from research to delivery of an MVP, working closely with the founder to define priorities and ensure technical feasibility. The result was a unified writing app that improved user productivity, engagement, and confidence.

sections.text: Talers is directly positioned in a maturing ContentTech market. The objective was to provide authors with a single, accessible platform to draft, organise, and prepare their work for publication.
Writers relied on fragmented workflows, often switching across multiple apps for drafting, editing, and note‑taking. This created friction, distraction, and loss of momentum.

Through interviews, competitor reviews, and ideation workshops with the founder and test users, we identified core needs and prioritised features. I designed wireframes, user flows and high‑fidelity prototypes to guide implementation.
The MVP delivered a clean, distraction-free writing interface with integrated notes, project organisation, and progress tracking. Export options were included to support publishing workflows.
Usability tests showed a 30% task completion gain and improved writing consistency. Early adopters reported higher satisfaction and reduced context switching during drafting.

quote.text: Collaborating on Talers was seamless. The design process balanced speed with rigor, and the outcome exceeded expectations—clean UX, clear priorities, and a product our early writers loved.
quote.author: Matthieu Gindre
